title: South Indian Filter Coffee
description: A rich, aromatic blend of freshly ground coffee and frothy milk, brewed using a traditional Indian coffee filter. This classic beverage is loved for its strong flavor and silky texture.

ingredients.notes: use freshly ground South Indian filter coffee blend
whole milk preferred for rich froth

instructions: Add 3 tablespoons of coffee powder to the upper part of a South Indian coffee filter.
Pour hot water over the coffee and cover the filter lid.
Allow the decoction to slowly drip into the lower container (takes 10â€“15 minutes).
In a saucepan, bring milk to a boil and add sugar as per taste.
Mix 1/4 cup of decoction with 3/4 cup of hot milk.
Pour the mixture back and forth between two cups to create froth.
Serve hot in a traditional steel tumbler and dabarah.
author: OceanKumar
notes: For stronger coffee, use a higher decoction-to-milk ratio. You can also add a pinch of chicory for authentic South Indian flavor.
